article_summary:
Instead, as we now see the full bloom of the imperial presidency, the administration’s level of incompetence is frightening.
White House blows it big time; accidentally outs CIA station chief in Kabul
More worrisome in Obama’s case is that the man has no experience or skills in hiring managers or executives to run things for him.
Incompetence in a president does not violate the law of the land, and neither does ruling by personal charisma.
In the 19th century, the men who were successful in the White House were mostly military men who thought strategically and knew how to run complex operations.
